guide.introduction: While my Thanksgiving menu is pretty predictable, the one thing that is really set in stone is Shallots in Red Wine. Based on a recipe in Roger Verge's Vegetables (possibly my favorite vegetable cookbook), this is a hit with absolutely everyone. The turkey may be the big-budget star the studio signs to get the movie funded, but the shallots are the character role that steals the picture.

lines.text: For 4 servings (note: make sure to make more than you think you need!)
lines.text_raw: For 4 servings (note: make sure to make more than you think you need!)

lines.text: 14 oz. medium shallots, preferably the same size
lines.text_raw: 14 oz. medium shallots, preferably the same size

lines.text: These are rough measurements; be sure to keep an eye on the shallots and adjust amounts to taste. Roger claims the dish takes 15 minutes to prep (true) and 20-30 minutes to cook, which is just ludicrous. For it to really be magical, the shallots need to cook slowly for closer to 2 hours, so stick them on a back burner while you work on other dishes.

lines.text: Peel the shallots and trim the ends.
lines.text_raw: Peel the shallots and trim the ends.

lines.text: Heat a bit more than half the butter in a heavy saucepan and cook the shallots until they're golden on both sides and starting to soften.
lines.text_raw: Heat a bit more than half the butter in a heavy saucepan and cook the shallots until they're golden on both sides and starting to soften.

lines.text: Then add the stock and salt. Simmer until there is only a tablespoon or two of stock left (turning the shallots every once in a while), and then add the wine.

lines.text: Simmer again until the shallots are about ready to melt, then remove them.

lines.text: Add the rest of the butter, turn up the heat, and reduce the wine sauce until it's thick and heavenly.

lines.text: Pour the wine sauce over the shallots on your best serving platter and prepare to watch them disappear.

guide.summary: An amazing side dish, these slow-cooked shallots will grace any table.
